Package utility

Class Bio

java.lang.Object
utility.Bio
public final class Bio
extends java.lang.Object
Comprises static methods that implement algorithms to solve specifically bioinformatics problems.

Currently only methods for sequence alignment exist which are used to align a nucleotide with a amino acid sequence. This is done in a special way by first translating the nucleotide sequence into an amino acid sequence. The alignment information is used to transform the translated nucleotide sequence back into a nucleotide sequence. This process is applied enable a visualization of the respective sequences and should not be used for general local sequence alignment.

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

  • Method Details

    • matchSequences

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> matchSequences​(java.lang.String aaSequence, java.lang.String nucSequence) throws org.biojava.nbio.core.exceptions.CompoundNotFoundException
      Matches a amino-acid and nucleotide sequence.

      This is done by translating the nucleotide sequence, for every possible frameshift if applicable, into a amino acid sequence and aligning the translated nucleotide sequence with the amino-acid sequence. The best alignment, here the one with the least number of gaps, is used as the best matching sequences.

      Parameters:
      aaSequence - String representing a amino-acid sequence.
      nucSequence - String representing a nucleotide sequence.
      Returns:
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> comprising the padded amino acid (at index 0) and nucleotide sequence (at index 1) that were derived as the best alignment.
      Throws:
      org.biojava.nbio.core.exceptions.CompoundNotFoundException - If a compound, i.e. amino acid, could not be translated.

    • translateNucSequence

      private static java.lang.String translateNucSequence​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitNucSequence)
      Translates a nucleotide sequence, split into codons of length three, into a single-letter amino acid sequence.
      Parameters:
      splitNucSequence - java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> representing a nucleotide sequence that was split into codons of length 3.
      Returns:
      String representing the translated nucleotide sequence.

    • alignSequences

      private static void alignSequences​(java.lang.String aaSequence, java.lang.String translatedAASequence, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitNucSequence, java.lang.String truncatedStart, java.lang.String truncatedEnd, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> resultsMap) throws org.biojava.nbio.core.exceptions.CompoundNotFoundException
      Conducts a local alignment of amino acid sequences using the BLOSUM62 scoring matrix.

      Thereby, one amino acid sequence is derived from a nucleotide sequence.

      Alignment gaps are replaced by special characters to separate alignment gaps from such gaps that are introduces to the passed nucleotide sequence by insertions of samples. In addition, the non-nucleotide-derived amino acid sequence is padded with symbols to represent a truncation of the original nucleotide sequence that may be present from a possible frameshift.

      The aligned translated nucleotide sequence is mapped back to a nucleotide sequence and, both, the nucleotide sequence and amino acid sequence are stored in a map accessible via the number of gaps in the alignment.

      Parameters:
      aaSequence - String representing a non-nucleotide-derived amino acid sequence.
      translatedAASequence - String representing a amino acid sequence that originates from translating a nucleotide sequence.
      splitNucSequence - String the original nucleotide sequence split into chunks of length three, i.e. codons.
      truncatedStart - String nucleotides that were truncated from the start of the nucleotide sequence due to a frameshift.
      truncatedEnd - String nucleotides that were truncated from the end of the nucleotide sequence due to a frameshift.
      resultsMap - HashMap mapping the alignment score, here the number of gaps, to the aligned sequences.
      Throws:
      org.biojava.nbio.core.exceptions.CompoundNotFoundException - If a compound, i.e. amino acid, could not be translated.

    • getReverseComplement

    • getPositionOnReverseComplement

      public static int getPositionOnReverseComplement​(int position, int start, int end)
      Returns the position q of a position p on the reverse complement of a genomic feature. TODO: End should be the full genome length, not only the end position of the feature.
      Parameters:
      position - Integer the position that should be converted.
      start - Integer the start position of the genomic feature on to the full genome.
      end - Integer the end position of the genomic feature on to the full genome.
      Returns:
      Integer representing the position on the reverse complement strand.
